poem:
**Unwritten Ledger**

In halls of paper and ink,  
the ghosts of labor speak,  
weighing hearts against  
machines of an obsolete beat.  
No longer will shadows  
from the forges of yesteryear  
bind the breath of the broken.  
Time's ledger unclenches—  
hope breathes, redrawn.
